intro: Disterigma leiopodandrum, commonly known as the smooth podded disterigma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of many Rubiaceae species. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
